info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 5:54AM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Pike, east central Polk and southwestern Montgomery Counties through 630 AM CDT... At 554 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Bard Springs Recreation Area, or 10 miles north of Umpire, moving southeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Bard Springs Recreation Area... Shady... Caney Creek Wilderness... Hartley... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Big Fork... Shady Lake Recreation Area... Fancyhill... Roaring Branch Natural Area... Lodi... Langley... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
